instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
Hello guys , please I need your help, have got a MacBook Air 11inch whose keyboard/trackpad will only work in OS and the keyboard fan runs in full speed. 

HISTORY : initially the machine would intermittently switch off , so I had to replace the SMC and it works except the issue above, so I thought maybe the SMC was not good so installed another one , but still the same.

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: Have you even tried a new trackpad/trackpad flex or at least inspected them for corrosion???

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
Inspect USB_TPAD_P/N lines for corrosion.
Post U4810 voltages before login to OSX; remove internal SSD to avoid system booting.
If also fan runs always high, makes me thinking both problems could be generated by trackpad board/flex.
Start trying known good ones.
You can run corresponding ASD EFI version and see what error pops up.

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: yes, and still same thing , Sorry for my late response

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: Thank you so much [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] and John .. I will post the value you requested tomorrow , we are closed now .. I appreciate your help

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
On U4810 
PIN 1 = 3.3V
PIN 2 = 0V
PIN 3 = 0V
PIN 4 = 0V
PIN 5 = 3.3V
PIN 6 = 0V
PIN 7 = 0V
PIN 8 = 3.3V

 TPAD_SPI_IF_EN_CONN circles between 0v,1v,2v when the keyboard is not connected , but straight 0V after connecting the keyboard

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: Also when I use an external keyboard trackpad it works in EFI

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
Missing TPAD_USB_IF_EN signal at U4810; check diode mode to ground.

I hope you measured with trackpad connected.

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 52192"]Missing TPAD_USB_IF_EN signal at U4810; check diode mode to ground.

I hope you measured with trackpad connected.[/QUOTE]

9Yes with trackpad connected, Diode mode to ground is OL

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message:
Check R1619.
If good, then is PCH issue.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post visible few centimeters above.
Maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: Thank you so much , will also refrain from the above

threads.title: 820-3435 keyboard trackpad only work in OS AND FAN RUNS IN FULL
threads.message: [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] Thank you so much, the machine worked , R1619 was 2.5V thank you everyone
